titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn police logbook 1985.045
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-31 19:57:39 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in one half size manuscript box.

did.abstract: A logbook of arrests by police officers in Brooklyn, 1860-1863. The logbook records individuals who were arrested and booked by the Brooklyn Police. Each entry includes the name of the individual arrested, the date on which the arrest and booking took place, the time at which the person was booked, and the offense for which the person was arrested.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single volume.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Description of entry, date; Brooklyn police logbook, 1985.045, page number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A logbook of arrests by police officers in Brooklyn, dated 1860 to 1863 and measuring 0.25 linear feet. The logbook records individuals who were arrested and booked by the Brooklyn Police. Each entry includes the name of the individual arrested, the date on which the arrest and booking took place, the time at which the person was booked, and the offense for which the person was arrested. The specific precinct to which this logbook belonged is not specified.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain.
